subject: Nutrition
title: Portion Size Illusion
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Portion Size Illusion.

hook.text: Serve the same pasta on a bigger plate and people eat 22% more without noticing any difference.

buildup.text: The brain estimates portion size relative to the container. A small plate makes portions look generous.

discovery.text: Large popcorn buckets caused moviegoers to eat 45% more than medium buckets in theater experiments.

twist.text: Even nutrition experts fall for it. Given large bowls, trained dietitians served themselves 31% more.

climax.text: American restaurant portions have doubled since the 1980s, silently doubling calorie intake with them.

punchline.text: Your plate decides how much you eat, not your stomach.

quiz.question: How much more did people eat from large popcorn buckets?
